80388935:
Petra's funky Surf Shack is an absolute little gem of a place, with the most wonderful aspect overlooking the surf break of Cowrie's Hole, in the laid back bohemian beach  suburb of Newcastle East.  Far from being a shack, this compact studio is actually very stylishly renovated, and thoughtfully planned in the style of a "tiny house," filled with clever space saving ideas, everything you need, and nothing you don't.  We were surprised to find heated towel rails, full length mirror, and frosted shower screen, which aren't really shown in the photos.  Even the contemporary black over-sized tap ware is perfect for filling the kettle - everything about this apartment just "works."  The shower pressure is perfect, and beautiful tiling throughout ties the whole space together.  The bed is extremely comfortable - 4 feather pillows, and spare blanket are supplied.  It wasn't cold when we stayed, but there is also a heater if needed.  
Petra kindly provides muesli and milk for breakfast, along with tea and coffee supplies.
We ate out for lunch and dinner during our stay, but enjoyed the view from the window seats over breakfast and happy hour.  We were lucky enough to see a pod of dolphins in the surf from our vantage point, although we missed the whale that Petra had seen earlier in the day. 
Self check in and check out was super easy with the lock box, and Petra kindly provided us with a resident parking permit to display on our car dashboard.  (available by request)
A map of the inner Newcastle area, wifi password, and many restaurant recommendations, were gratefully accepted.
Being an historic terrace house, there are steps to negotiate from the studio to street level, however these are well lit at night to ensure they are safe.
We absolutely loved our stay in Newcastle, and feel it is an extremely under-rated city, with so much to offer, easy to get around on foot to everything,  beautiful historic buildings everywhere, and a really cool vibe.  We would absolutely recommend staying at Petra's Surf Shack, and would love to stay here again if we are ever back in Newcastle!

I booked Donna's apartment for my mum to spend a week in Newcastle for a bit of a holiday and this is what she said about her stay...

WOW!, I would love to come back to this place again.  The unit was in a central position with bus at the door, yet so quiet and peaceful inside. 

In one day I was able to walk past the new university building, along the waterfront at Honeysuckle and up to the shopping centre at the mall.  I continued my walk past the cinemas to interesting Darby Street and visited the art gallery, the library and then back to the unit through civic park. 

After my walks each day it was great to go back and enjoy some Netflix, catch up on emails with the WiFi, then jump into a very comfortable bed (with beautiful bamboo sheets) and enjoy a great night sleep. 

I can't think of anything that was missing and I'm looking forward to my next stay.

The foreshore was a 10-15 minute walk away and restaurants and cafes were close by. We recommend the new Thai restaurant and The Great Northern pub both within a short walk. 
The local buses, also nearby, were regular and there was a free city centre zone. The light rail is due to open this month. 
We enjoyed our stay in Newcastle and would like to return to Vivienne’ s for any future visits.

29612572:
Das Appartement hat eine wunderbare Lage von der aus man mit Glück Wale  beobachten kann., wenn nicht, dann zumindest Surfer ‍♂️ 

Das Bett möchte ich besonders erwähnen, urgemütlich auch für Rückengeschädigte. 
Die 2. Schlafmöglichkeit war wohl weniger bequem. 

Wettermäßig hatte ich ziemliches Pech, was ich aber auch nur erwähne, weil es bei kräftigem Wind heftig zieht im Appartement. 
Da war ich dankbar, dass meine Tochter mir eine Wärmflasche besorgt hatte. 

Leider lieg so einiges schief während meines Aufenthaltes, wobei Carly stets prompt reagierte und versuchte Abhilfe zu schaffen. 

Bei diesem Preis war ich erstaunt über verrostete Gardinenstangen und löchrige Gardinen. 
Ebenso erwarte ich, dass beide Kochstellen funktionieren und nicht nur eine. 
Dass zeitweise das Warmwasser ausfiel und dadurch kein Aufwärmen unter der Dusche möglich war, beeinträchtigte das Wohlgefühl. 
Die laute Dauerlüftung (vom Bad?) raubte mir leider den Schlaf. 

Dass der Trockner nicht nutzbar war, wurde uns erst nach mehreren Versuchen mitgeteilt (jetzt ist ein Aufkleber drauf).
Als unzumutbar empfand ich den Zustand der Waschmaschine, wegen starkem Schwarzschimmel-Befall, den ich größtenteils entfernte. 
Den Rest hat Carly am nächsten Tag erledigt. 
Zum Schluss habe ich zwei dunkle Teile in der Maschine gewaschen...sie waren anschließend komplett weiß verfusselt. 
Reaktion: Das käme daher, dass ich vorher weiße Handtücher gewaschen hätte. 
Ok, das war mir nicht bekannt, meine Maschine wäscht beides, ohne Flusen. 

Alles in allem denke ich, es war einfach Pech, dass so viele Dinge nicht stimmig waren. 
Carlys Bemühungen möchte ich noch mal hervorheben, die Kommunikation war hervorragend. 

Check in/ out super easy. 

Den künftigen Besuchern wünsche ich  mehr Glück

42410597:
My girlfriend and I stayed here 1 night, and we didn’t have the best of experiences. I’ll start with the pros: the property is in a great location, the house is big and spacious, and is pretty clean everywhere (apart from the one small cockroach we saw in the kitchen), and when we arrived Kerry gave us lots of information about what to see and do in the local area.

Before I continue, I would like to state that we booked this home at the last minute as a stop on our way to Byron Bay, so all we looked at was the price and location, and we didn’t fully read the description written by Kerry, and we were unaware of a rule that we broke - you’re not allowed to cook after you’ve checked out.

We were very sorry for doing this, and we feel that Kerry handled the situation in an unfair manner.  We were out all day, and didn’t have transport booked until 9pm, when we returned to the home we thought to cook some food as we hadn’t eaten and we wanted to have something cooked as we were arriving at our next destination very late. Kerry came in while we were cooking and advised us that this was not part of the deal, we understood, cleaned up everything we were using, apologised, and advised that as soon as the food was cooked that we would pack it up. We didn’t have enough Tupperware, so I ran to get some. When I came back, my girlfriend told me that Kerry felt the need to mention to her next guests about our rule breaking (she was told this by the guests, who really didn’t mind us being there), and that Kerry had told my girlfriend ‘you better leave’ when I came back. 

It was 5pm by this point, and my girlfriend was left feeling very awakened and uncomfortable, despite apologising at every opportunity that she could. We had to wait in the streets for our bus for 4 hours.

We felt very bad for not reading the full description, and for breaking this rule, we do not deny what we did. But we feel that Kerry could have dealt with it differently, as we cleaned everything up instantly and as soon as we could get the food off of the hob, we did. The kitchen was cleaner than when we started! There was no one around who wanted to use the kitchen either. And we certainly didn’t enjoy waiting for our bus, hungry and cold. We wouldn’t stay here again.

The studio was tastefully decorated, extremely clean, very neat and tidy and had a good feel. We like to prepare our meals and there was the right utensil for every need. 

There is no car parking included but with a little planning we were able to 
juggle most of our paid on street parking. We reasoned that the good value of the apartment allowed for some paid on street car parking during the day - and  not a problem if you don't have a car or are away all day.

25676750: We recently stayed at Nikki's place for 9 nights.  We had a fantastic stay and highly recommend Nikki's place. Nikki's guest info was spot on, food and art gallery recommendations gladly used and comforting to see info re: local medical services etc.  Her pantry of good quality basics came in handy as well.

8206962:
We had a wonderful stay. When we return to Newcastle we will definitely try to stay here again. James was a great host and he was very helpful with information and recommendations about the area. He introduced us to Goldberg's Coffee House on Darby - an absolutely wonderful restaurant - both food and service are top notch and prices are very reasonable.
The room is upstairs - not a problem for us, but take note - the stairs are narrow and steep. The house is located on a fairly steep hill, again, not a problem for us, but take note - you will be walking this hill. These are not negatives for us - in fact we enjoyed the exercise.
The bedroom is nicely appointed and includes a small fridge. James provided milk, muesli, coffee, a one cup press, and an electric heater - which even though the temperatures were cool we did not need to use. We found the queen bed quite comfortable. The bathroom is long and narrow and includes a shower which we found to be quite nice. There is a balcony which we enjoyed. The views from the room and the balcony are of the tree-lined street. Very pleasant. And very quiet for a place in the middle of old town Newcastle.
We can't say enough good things about James or the room. We can only emphasize that we will try to stay there again on a future visit.
Thanks for everything James!
32991800: James' house was so beautiful and had everything we needed.
